## coe_datasets()

Display information on all datasets available through this package. Default is to return a two-column tibble including `nomis_code` and `description`, but setting `description = FALSE` will return a character vector of all valid nomis codes which can be passed to functions such as `coe_stats()` 

```{r examples-coe_datasets}
coe_datasets()
```


## coe_stats

```{r examples-coe_stats}
coe_stats(nomis_code =  "TS001", level = "england")
coe_stats(nomis_code = "TS001", level = "diocese", areas = 1)
```



## coe_parish_in_context

```{r examples-coe_parish_in_context}
coe_parish_in_context(parish_code = "370047", nomis_codes = "TS001")
```
